  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jimweller.cpuscheduler.CPUScheduler

extends java.lang.Object
    Fixed a few warnings in this class.

    0.51 Spring 2016
    Author:
    Charles Zhu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CPUScheduler()
      Default constructor which builds DEF_PROC_COUNT randomly generated processes and loads them into the job queue
      CPUScheduler(java.io.File filename)
      Articulate constructor that reads the process data from a file.
      CPUScheduler(java.lang.String filename)
      Articulate constructor that reads the process data from a file.
      CPUScheduler(java.util.Vector<Process> ap)
      Articulate constructor that allows the programmer to design his/her own Vector of processes and use them in the scheduler

    • Field Detail

      • schedulingAlgorithm

        private SchedulingAlgorithm schedulingAlgorithm
        Which scheduling algorithm is in use currently

      • DEF_PROC_COUNT

        private static final int DEF_PROC_COUNT
        The default number of processes to randomly generate. The programmer can use the articulate constructor to build their own process set of any length
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • currentTime

        private long currentTime
        This simulates elapsed time.

      • idle

        private long idle
        The amount of elapsed idle time.

      • busy

        private long busy
        The amount of elapsed time that the CPU was kept busy.

      • procsIn

        private int procsIn
        The number of jobs submitted for execution.

      • procsOut

        private int procsOut
        the number of jobs that have been executed to completion.

      • priority

        private boolean priority
        Whether to use priority weights for the round robin algorithm.

      • allProcs

        private java.util.Vector<Process> allProcs
        The collection of all processes involved in this simulation. Extraneous now but handy for debugging.

      • jobQueue

        private java.util.Vector<Process> jobQueue
        The collection of all jobs that will be used

      • readyQueue

        private java.util.Vector<Process> readyQueue
        The collection of all jobs that have arrived and require CPU time.

      • activeJob

        private Process activeJob
        A reference to the currently active job. The cpu changes this reference to different jobs in the ready queue using the respective algorithm's criteria

      • CPUScheduler

        Default constructor which builds DEF_PROC_COUNT randomly generated processes and loads them into the job queue

      • CPUScheduler

        CPUScheduler(java.util.Vector<Process> ap)

        Articulate constructor that reads the process data from a file.

      • nextCycle

        public boolean nextCycle()
        Just run one cycle of the simulation. This represents one time unit.
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if more cycles remain to be run.

      • cleanUp

        void cleanUp()
        Purge the runtime queues

      • resetAlgorithm

        public void resetAlgorithm()
        Creates a new algorithm of the current type to reset it.

      • restore

        public void restore()
        Restore time and statistic variables to their defaults. Also restores all processes to original state and reloads the queues. Leaves algorithm configurations alone an other state variables.

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()

      • getPreemption

        public int getPreemption()
        Get an int reflecting the preemption setting of the current algorithm
        Returns:
        positive if preemptive,
        zero for non-preemptive,
        negative if not applicable to the current algorithm
